The admin lobby is arranged like the facility still expects the public.
A kiosk hums in a way that suggests it has never once been thanked.
On the wall: a laminated phone list, corners curled.
Near the desk: a metal plaque, sun-faded, with an asset seal that refuses to die.
The reception drawers sit slightly misaligned, like someone left in a hurry and then filed a memo about it.

nodes.text:
The kiosk screen is touch-sensitive in the way old glass pretends to be.
A header reads: SPINDLE ADMIN SERVICES — LOBBY ACCESS.

WELCOME.
SELECT A SERVICE CATEGORY.
UNAUTHORIZED USE IS SUBJECT TO REVIEW.

choices.text: show "Show OLEA credentials to the kiosk."

nodes.text:
DIRECTORY ACCESS IS LIMITED IN LOBBY MODE.
SEARCH RETURNS TITLES ONLY.
NAMES REQUIRE AUTHENTICATION.

You try a simple keyword.

RESULTS:
— RECEPTION (UNSTAFFED)
— RECEPTION OVERSIGHT (TEMPORARY)
— RECEPTION — AFTER HOURS PROTOCOL

Selecting a result requires authentication.
It won’t give names. It will give vocabulary.

WORK ORDER SUBMISSION REQUIRES A SPONSOR ID.
LOBBY MODE MAY PRINT STANDARD FORMS.
SELECT: PRINT / CANCEL.

PRINTING: OLEA LEGACY ENERGY ASSETS — SPINDLE SITE
FORM HEADER ONLY. NO ROUTING NUMBER ISSUED.

A page feeds out: official letterhead, a site identifier line, and blank fields waiting to be lied into.

TO REPORT A SAFETY CONDITION: LIFT HANDSET AT RECEPTION DESK.
IF NO HANDSET IS PRESENT, COMPLETE FORM S-14 “CONDITION NOTICE.”
DO NOT USE EMERGENCY CODES IN LOBBY MODE.

LOBBY MODE IS NOT A CONTROL ENVIRONMENT.
“EMERGENCY” IMPLIES AUTHORITY.
AUTHORITY MUST BE VERIFIED.

CREDENTIAL PRESENTED.
CREDENTIAL NOT VERIFIED.
LIMITATION ADJUSTED: LIMITED LOBBY MODE ENABLED.
YOU MAY:
— PRINT STANDARD HEADERS
— VIEW TITLES AND EXTENSIONS
— INITIATE A CALL REQUEST

It doesn’t let you in. It does teach you what “in” is supposed to look like.

The wall list is laminated over older laminated paper.
Someone updated it by adding a sticker that has started to peel, like it’s trying to exit the organization.

Extensions. Departments. Titles that sound like they were invented to move blame around.
You pick up the rhythm: short numbers for operations, longer for compliance, and a separate block labeled EXTERNAL LIAISONS as if the building is ashamed of them.

The list offers safe-sounding titles: Temporary Oversight, Records Custodian (Acting), Facilities Liaison.
None of them promise presence. All of them promise deniability.

A boxed note: AFTER HOURS: DO NOT CONTACT SECURITY FOR ADMIN MATTERS.
Under it, smaller: SECURITY WILL CONTACT YOU IF NECESSARY.
It reads like a threat that was formatted by committee.
